item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S2006-2007; text as passed Senate: CR S2007; text of measure as introduced: CR S2004)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S2006-2007; text as passed Senate: CR S2007; text of measure as introduced: CR S2004)

summary.text:
Extends the sympathy of the Senate to the families of Marie Colvin and other reporters who have died reporting from conflict zones and recognizes their bravery.

Calls on the government of Syria to halt the brutal attacks against the people of Syria and to respect their human rights.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

Extends the sympathy of the Senate to the families of Marie Colvin and other reporters who have died reporting from conflict zones.

Recognizes the bravery of Ms. Colvin and other correspondents and photographers who have lost their lives while exposing the truth.

Calls on: (1) the world community to honor the memories of Ms. Colvin and other reporters, and (2) the government of Syria to halt the brutal attacks against the people of Syria and to respect their human rights.

bill.title: A resolution recognizing the life and work of war correspondent Marie Colvin and other courageous journalists in war zones.

item.title: A resolution recognizing the life and work of war correspondent Marie Colvin and other courageous journalists in war zones.
A resolution recognizing the life and work of war correspondent Marie Colvin and other courageous journalists in war zones.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
